evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

roots_spec.exclusion_clause: Not explained by any other root

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, specifically in the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew remains robust and resistant to alternative interpretations or defeaters when considering the context of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident in the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew aligns with key features of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 incident, particularly during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early timeframe, reflecting typical patterns of crew interaction failures.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observable and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase on 12-25.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identified procedural deviation withstands alternative explanations and contradicting evidence, maintaining its validity as a root cause in the pushback execution context for the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_pair_engine_t1_early case.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation aligns with key features identified in pushback operations, including timing, crew actions, and communication protocols specific to the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA hist_pair_engine_t1_early scenario.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident and observable during the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, specifically in the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase.

assumptions: Assuming that the failure to stop at the TRP despite communication attempts indicates a coordination breakdown.
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication preventing the incident or no observable coordination issues, the claim would be weakened.

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H3 shows active communication and coordination attempts among crew and tug operators, but H4-H5 indicate a failure to stop at the TRP leading to collision, supporting observable communication/coordination breakdown during the incident phase.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in whether the procedural deviation or environment factors contributed more to the incident

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observable and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase on 12-25.

assumptions: The described events in H1-H5 occurred during the hist_pair_engine_t1_early phase on 12-25 for Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA
defeaters: If evidence showed the movement beyond TRP was due to communication failure rather than procedural deviation
If environmental or mechanical factors were documented as primary causes

quotes.exact_quote: The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H4 directly documents the procedural deviation in pushback execution with the aircraft moving beyond the TRP and hitting the blast barrier, while H2-H3 describe the pushback process and crew actions, supporting observability and documentation of the deviation.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing procedural deviation from communication breakdown without further communication logs
